revised_title: Exploring Attribute Associations in Statistics and Their Applications
tldr: The authors, G. Udny Yule and Karl Pearson, introduce the concept of attribute association in statistics and present a coefficient of association to measure the degree of association between attributes. They provide various examples, including smallpox attack rates, inheritance of artistic talent, and plant crossing, to demonstrate the application of their methods. The authors also discuss the connection between correlation and association and highlight the differences in association and correlation between genders and age groups.
